Posts.Content: Hi Dawn, Just wishing you and your mum luck, I haven't much advice but I have recently been diagnosed with a similar tumor. I'm starting chemo next week. Don't know anything about hormone treatment.  Lots of luck though  Liz xxxx
Posts.Title: Mums breast cancer diagnosis

Posts.Content: Thankyou ALL so much for taking the time to reply, it means a lot. None of us want to be here but we are so it's thinking positive. Wink I will definitely join the chemo group (thankyou), when does your chemo start as mine starts next Wed? Yellowroses, I just googled Macmillan and then joined as everybody seems very supportive. Leolady yes I plan to let school know, they're on half term, this week, thanks for the advice and good luck with the chemo, must let me know what it's like. Buddha7 thanks for the advice I'll also be having Herceptin as one of the drugs xxxxx
Posts.Title: Just diagnosed with breast cancer:-(

Posts.Content: Good, glad the hair style is nice. Let's try this tagging then xxx No I'm afraid it's only tagging words and not people xx
Posts.Title: Just diagnosed with breast cancer:-(

Posts.Content: Hello, Just wanted to say hi to everyone, reading through lots of threads and you all sound like such amazing ladies.  I was diagnosed on Friday, I think that's probably the most scary bit as had a CT scan Saturday and a meeting with the oncologist today followed by an MRI and an echocardiogram in the morning and chemo is starting next Wed for 18 weeks. Jeez this time last week I had a perfect life. Trying to stay positive Just wondering how people cope with chemo, I have 3 young children and need to stay active for school runs and a toddler at home.  Thanks in advance xxxxxx
Posts.Title: Just diagnosed with breast cancer:-(

Posts.Content: Leolady,  I start Wed and I have Thursday as well as I'm also having Herceptin. Both 8am in the morning. Can't wait to just get started now. How's the new hair cut?  Xxxxc
Posts.Title: Just diagnosed with breast cancer:-(

Posts.Content: Hi ladies,  there are some wonderful crafts on here. How do I add a pic, can't see to do it on here xxxx
Posts.Title: Crafts and BC

Posts.Content: Ruby Rose, I feel heart broken for you hun. So many hugs xxxxx Lots of love xxxxx
Posts.Title: *** April 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: Wow ladies, you have really gone through it with all the hospital visits. Thinking of you all. I start my first cycle tomorrow at 8am, can anyone recommend the best thermometer to use as I've not picked one up yet, (am hoping the hospital may give me one but not holding out much hope) Xxxx
Posts.Title: *** April 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: Thankyou Concepta. Been on the Herceptin about an hour, docetexal and carboplatin after lunch and cold cap. Feeling so happy these drugs are running through my system, hope the herceptin is already started to kick it's ass, feeling so positive now the treatment has started.  Hope everybody has a great day Xxxx
Posts.Title: *** April 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: Thanks so much Cathy, yes the docetaxel is scaring me, I'll keep you updated xx
Posts.Title: *** April 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: Hi ladies, I am starting chemo next week. I'm terrified after reading all these posts, I'm having Herceptin, docetaxel and carboplatin and perjeta!!!!! It seems all these drugs are really strong and I'm having loads. And I have 3 young boys and school runs. Do I need to be scared or can I get through this with anti sickness drugs xxxxxx I start treatment next Wed and Thurs then once every 3 weeks xxxx TIA
Posts.Title: *** April 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: Thanks Sammystaff I'll pick one up later. Just waiting to start treatment. Eeekkkkkk xx
Posts.Title: *** April 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: Sammystaff My boys are 9,8 and 2, missing them like crazy. I have asked about 8 different people today for my own room to no avail.  Yes self diagnosing however looking at SE"s for docetexal and carboplatin today and it said bleeding and low platelets.  Docs have given me steroids but no more platelets today. Just been talking to a lovely nurse right now she said we can leave the room and go to the loo and she said it's shocking I'm in this room with sick people and I should ring Christie's tomorrow and get some advice. So depending on what docs say I may have to discharge myself. I have literally been sat on a bed since Sunday night. How are you finding things with 2 little ones? They really keep you going don't they. So glad you can go ahead with your 2nd treatment, this thing just need kicking into touch doesnt it  Xxx
Posts.Title: *** April 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: Arrrgghhh So my platelets are dangerously low, having a blood transfusion shortly, waiting on a bed, they said this is really unusual to happen after chemo, just hope they don't change my chemo. May have to stay in a couple of days.  Hope everyone else is ok, many hugs xxx
Posts.Title: *** April 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: Weeblemum Thankyou. You're probably right about the platelets prior to chemo. My OH said one of my boys has been crying tonight, I'm so sad, I am getting out of here tomorrow. On a plus, the lovely nurse who is shocked I've been on that ward has just got me my own room. So just moved in at midnight. I'm still out of here tomorrow though. Xxx
Posts.Title: *** April 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: Hi ladies, Yes I got out, I had to tell 3 different doctors I was going home, they wanted me to stay in so they said they'd chat to me after my bloods. Platelets cane back at 10, not good but an improvement on 2. I'm on steroids, the Trans thingy acid tablet and another tablet so feel like I'm rattling and not sleeping at all. I had to go back in yesterday for more bloods and the hematology doctor rung me personally to say platelets are now 49. Wow best bit of news all week. Got an emergency oncologist meeting on Monday, I guess to discuss treatment but I really want to stay on TCH-P as it's what I need. I've seen online papaya leaf extract brings platelets up so I'll be mentioning that. And apart from the thrombocytopenia I have had NO side effects, no sickness, no  D or aching muscles. It's amazing to be home and I reckon after this week I can take anything this treatment throws at me. Sorry for the long post, I hope all you lovely ladies are well and I'll catch up with your posts tomorrow Much love xxxx
Posts.Title: *** April 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: Sat in A and E, chemo Thursday was fine but is obviously not agreeing with me  now, bleeding gums heavy period, bruising..... damn and thought I'd got away with the S.E's....... Leolady and Judith, hope you're well after your A and E visits, nightmare isn't it. I'm still waiting on blood results, hoping they let me home tonight xx
Posts.Title: *** April 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: Thankyou Katiepie xxx
Posts.Title: *** April 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: Thanks ladies The whole week just seems a bit unreal. My bloods today have shown no changes in platelets so they're keeping me in. Not seen kids since Sunday. As all other blood levels are ok apart from platelets, they're worried. Just had some steroids and I think they're testing for further stuff with more blood tests. Obviously the first thing that comes to be mind is mestastis, apparently chemo doesn't lower your platelets for at least the first 10 days so my platelets should, in effect, still be normal.  I have had no other side effects apart from bleeding. Thank god I've not got the big D as we have to use a commode.  Hope everyone is all well, woman opposite me (who got the ward shut down) keeps shouting for a bed pan and another woman keeps chatting rubbish to me.  Xxx
Posts.Title: *** April 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: Leolady  It isn't good. Platelets should be 150/200 and mine are 2..... I'm gonna need bags of them....... And doc said this could happen after every chemo. I am on a medical assessment ward with 3 older women snoring their heads off. Help........
Posts.Title: *** April 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: Hi Maisie17 Thanks, they're moving me to a hematology/oncology ward now for more Platelets. So been on medical assessment ward all day with 3 ladies coughing and spluttering everywhere, and now the woman next to me is being moved to the same ward. You couldn't write the script xx
Posts.Title: *** April 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: That's good news, glad the headaches have gone and BP back to normal. I'm sure they're keeping me in here, had that many tests and they were asking about my heart cos it's beating quite fast, can't understand all this bleeding though, didn't expect it as a side effect xx
Posts.Title: *** April 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: Hi hun I am on a much better ward, had another bag of platelets. They had forgotten to give me my clotting pills (I went in cos I was bleeding) so finally got them at 8pm and the bleeding has started to get less, have another 2 at midnight. I am concerned about tomorrow as I don't think they'll let me home yet and I need to go home and be with my family but platelets very low still. Wondering what they will do regarding treatment as I don't want it changed...... we will see xx
Posts.Title: *** April 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: So the horror story gets worse. I am still here.......but someone in my ward has diahorrea and my ward has been isolated. Can't leave to go to the loo or go and get a coffee. Stuck here like a prisoner. My kids were gonna visit tonight. I feel like I am going mad. I've said I'm on chemo and shouldn't be around ill people but nobody has moved me. And it could be tomorrow before they open the doors to my ward. (When I say ward I mean the room I'm in with 3 other people). If anyone needs the loo they'll bring a commode in. FFS I really can't cope with this whilst being on chemo too xxx
Posts.Title: *** April 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Club ***
